oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-08-23 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First part of recording contains part 1 of a Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 23, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer), guest performer Benny Martin and his sister JoAnn Martin, Rod Brasfield (performer), Tommy Jackson (performer), Chet Atkins (performer), June Carter (performer), and Del Wood (performer), held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 985th broadcast. Second part of recording contains excerpts from radio program the Red Foley Show, featuring Joe Slattery (announcer), Red Foley (host/performer), Doc Martin (performer), Marksmen Quartet (performers), Suzi Arden (performer), Ernest Tubb (performer), and Cecil Brauer (performer), date and episode number unknown.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Porter Wagoner; Rod Brasfield; Benny Martin; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins; June Carter; Del Wood; Red Foley; Doc Martin; Marksmen Quartet; Suzi Arden; Ernest Tubb; Cecil Brauer
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Grant Turner introduces Porter Wagoner -- (00:13) Tell Her Lies And Feed Her Candy (Porter Wagoner) -- (01:54) Opening statements (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- (02:25) Wagoner introduces Rod Brasfield -- (02:36) Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Porter Wagoner) -- (06:36) Wagoner introduces Benny Martin -- (07:28) Border Baby (Benny Martin) -- (10:00) Wagoner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Sally Ann (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- (10:50) Porter Wagoner talks and introduces a hymn -- (11:20) Heaven's Just A Prayer Away (Porter Wagoner) -- (13:30) Turner thanks Wagoner, Wagoner introduces Chet Atkins -- (13:51) Say "Si Si" (Chet Atkins electric guitar) -- (15:47) Wagoner thanks Atkins, Turner and Wagoner introduce June Carter -- (16:24) Comedy routine (June Carter, Porter Wagoner) -- (20:05) Wagoner introduces Del Wood -- (20:10) Whirl Away (Del Wood piano) -- (21:28) Wagoner thanks Wood, and introduces the next tune -- (21:41) Haven't You Heard (Porter Wagoner) -- (23:45) Closing statements and theme (Porter Wagoner, Grant Turner) -- (24:15) Smokey Mountain Boogie (Red Foley) -- (25:55) Foley talks about the show -- (26:13) U.S. Armed Forces commercial -- (27:08) Just What The Doctor Ordered (Doc Martin) -- (28:22) Foley thanks Doc Martin, and introduces the Marksmen Quartet -- (29:00) Marksmen Quartet talks about the Red Foley Show -- (29:23) My Blue Heaven (Marksmen Quartet) -- (31:36) Foley introduces the next tune -- Bound For The Kingdom (Red Foley, Marksmen Quartet) -- (35:23) Foley thanks the Marksmen Quartet -- (35:33) Luxembourg vacation commercial -- (37:05) Foley introduces Suzi Arden -- (37:22) Bonaparte's Retreat (Suzi Arden) -- (39:15) Foley thanks Arden, and introduces Ernest Tubb -- (39:50) Tubb talks with Foley and introduces the next tune -- (40:33) Hey Mr. Bluebird (Ernest Tubb) -- (42:35) commercial -- (44:24) [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Cecil Brauer fiddle) -- (45:26) Foley and Tubb talk and introduces the next tune -- (46:06) Never (Red Foley, Suzi Arden) -- (47:57) Closing statements and theme (Red Foley, Joe Slattery)
